page.title: 18LIFESTYLES, GRAINTHORPE
page.content: There are at irregular intervals various {fashion and beauty parties } at private houses. The {Black Horse Inn}provides liquid refreshment and has a Beer Garden at the rear. Evening revellers requiring something more substantial are directed to{ {Grainthorpe Hall},built c1670 by William Loft.At the end of the 18th century a third floor was added as servants' quarters.It was only in the fourth families' hands in 1939 when it was commandeered by the Coldstream Guards.W Sowby, a local grocer,bought the Hall in 1946 and it was sold to Terence McVeigh of Grimsby in 1973. The McVeighs extensively renovated the Hall and Mrs.McVeigh(nee HOLMGREN of Sandhamn,Sweden) started a Swedish style Smorgasbord Restaurant on 13th August 1977.
